required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Single Dose Bioequivalence Study of 2 Different Doses of Mini Cherry Nicotine Lozenges

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the bio equivalence of new nicotine lozenge formulation with the reference nicotine lozenge so as to deliver the same nicotine blood profile.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time Zero to Time t [AUC(0-t)]
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples taken pre-dose and post-dose at 3, 5, 10, 15, 20, 30, 40, and 50 minutes, and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10 and 12 hours
primary_outcome.description: AUC(0-t) was evaluated using the trapezoid rule.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples taken pre-dose and post-dose at 3, 5, 10, 15, 20, 30, 40, and 50 minutes, and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10 and 12 hours
primary_outcome.description: Cmax was depicted from plasma concentration of nicotine.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples taken pre-dose and post-dose at 3, 5, 10, 15, 20, 30, 40, and 50 minutes, and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10 and 12 hours
secondary_outcome.description: AUC (0-inf) was evaluated using the trapezoid rule.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Plasma Nicotine Concentration (Tmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples taken pre-dose and post-dose at 3, 5, 10, 15, 20, 30, 40, and 50 minutes, and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10 and 12 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Tmax was time at which Cmax of nicotine was reached.

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent Elimination Half-life of Nicotine T(1/2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples taken pre-dose and post-dose at 3, 5, 10, 15, 20, 30, 40, and 50 minutes, and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10 and 12 hours
secondary_outcome.description: T(1/2) was calculated using plasma time-concentration values.

secondary_outcome.measure: Elimination Rate Constant for Plasma Nicotine: K (el)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples taken pre-dose and post-dose at 3, 5, 10, 15, 20, 30, 40, and 50 minutes, and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10 and 12 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Kel was calculated with the help of plasma time concentration values.

arm_group.description: 2 mg test nicotine lozenge to be chewed.
4 mg test nicotine lozenge to be chewed.
2 mg reference nicotine lozenge to be chewed.
4 mg reference nicotine lozenge to be chewed.

intervention.description: 2 mg nicotine lozenge in two formulations
4 mg nicotine lozenge in two formulations

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants must be healthy smokers who usually smoked their first cigarette within 30 minutes of waking.
- Body Mass Index within the range 19-27 kilograms/meters^2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants who used chewing tobacco or tobacco products other than cigarettes within 21 days of screening visit

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited at the clinical site.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Out of 141 participants screened, only 50 were randomized since 91 were screen failures.

group.title: 2 Milligram (mg) Cherry Lozenge
group.description: Participants were instructed to move the 2mg Cherry mini nicotine lozenge from one side of the mouth to the other periodically and not to swallow or chew the lozenge.

group.title: 2mg Mint Lozenge
group.description: Participants were instructed to move the 2mg Mint (peppermint) mini nicotine lozenge from one side of the mouth to the other periodically and not to swallow or chew the lozenge.

group.title: 4mg Cherry Lozenge
group.description: Participants were instructed to move the 4mg Cherry mini nicotine lozenge from one side of the mouth to the other periodically and not to swallow or chew the lozenge.

group.title: 4mg Mint Lozenge
group.description: Participants were instructed to move the 4mg Mint mini nicotine lozenge from one side of the mouth to the other periodically and not to swallow or chew the lozenge.

group.title: All Randomized Participants
group.description: All randomized participants were evaluated for baseline measures

outcome.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time Zero to Time t [AUC(0-t)]
outcome.description: AUC(0-t) was evaluated using the trapezoid rule.
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples taken pre-dose and post-dose at 3, 5, 10, 15, 20, 30, 40, and 50 minutes, and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10 and 12 hours
outcome.population: Analysis was done per intention to treat (ITT) population.

group.title: 2mg Cherry Lozenge
group.description: Participants were instructed to move the 2mg Cherry mini nicotine lozenge from one side of the mouth to the other periodically and not to swallow or chew the lozenge

group.title: 2mg Mint Lozenge
group.description: Participants were instructed to move the 2mg Mint (peppermint) mini nicotine lozenge from one side of the mouth to the other periodically and not to swallow or chew the lozenge

group.title: 4mg Cherry Lozenge
group.description: Participants were instructed to move the 4mg Cherry mini nicotine lozenge from one side of the mouth to the other periodically and not to swallow or chew the lozenge

group.title: 4mg Mint Lozenge
group.description: Participants were instructed to move the 4mg Mint (peppermint) mini nicotine lozenge from one side of the mouth to the other periodically and not to swallow or chew the lozenge

measure.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time Zero to Time t [AUC(0-t)]
measure.description: AUC(0-t) was evaluated using the trapezoid rule.
measure.population: Analysis was done per intention to treat (ITT) population.

analysis.groups_desc: The value was log-transformed and a linear mixed effects model was applied to this value, as the dependent variable, treatment, and period as fixed effects and participants as random effect.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Bio-equivalence between two dosage treatments was concluded if the 90% confidence interval for the ratio of the means for AUC (0-t) lies within the interval 0.80 to 1.25.
analysis.estimate_desc: Geometric mean ratio of Cherry and Mint lozenge was determined by exponentiating least-squares means of log-transformed value.

analysis.groups_desc: The value was log-transformed and a linear mixed effects model was applied to this value, as the dependent variable, treatment, and period as fixed effects and participants as random effect.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Bio-equivalence between two dosage treatments was concluded if the 90% confidence interval for the ratio of the means for AUC (0-t) lies within the interval 0.80 to 1.25.
analysis.estimate_desc: Geometric mean ratio of Cherry and Mint lozenge was determined by exponentiating least-squares means of log-transformed value.

measure.title: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration [Cmaximum (Max)]
measure.description: Cmax was depicted from plasma concentration of nicotine.
measure.population: Analysis was done per intention to treat (ITT) population.

analysis.groups_desc: The value was log-transformed and a linear mixed effects model was applied to this value, as the dependent variable, treatment, and period as fixed effects and participants as random effect.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Bio-equivalence between two dosage treatments was concluded if the 90% confidence interval for the ratio of the means for Cmax lies within the interval 0.80 to 1.25.
analysis.estimate_desc: Geometric mean ratio of Cherry and Mint lozenge was determined by exponentiating least-squares means of log-transformed value.

analysis.groups_desc: The value was log-transformed and a linear mixed effects model was applied to this value, as the dependent variable, treatment, and period as fixed effects and participants as random effect.

analysis.estimate_desc: Geometric mean ratio of Cherry and Mint lozenge was determined by exponentiating least-squares means of log-transformed value.

outcome.title: Time to Reach Maximum Plasma Nicotine Concentration (Tmax)
outcome.description: Tmax was time at which Cmax of nicotine was reached.
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples taken pre-dose and post-dose at 3, 5, 10, 15, 20, 30, 40, and 50 minutes, and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10 and 12 hours
outcome.population: Analysis was done per intention to treat (ITT) population.

group.description: Participants were instructed to move the 2mg Cherry mini nicotine lozenge from one side of the mouth to the other periodically and not to swallow or chew the lozenge

measure.title: Time to Reach Maximum Plasma Nicotine Concentration (Tmax)
measure.description: Tmax was time at which Cmax of nicotine was reached.
measure.population: Analysis was done per intention to treat (ITT) population.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis considered that there is no median within-subject difference between two treatment groups.
analysis.method_desc: The value of Tmax was adjusted for this non-parametric analysis.
analysis.estimate_desc: The median difference was calculated as Cherry minus Peppermint.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis considered that there is no median within-subject difference between two treatment groups.
analysis.method_desc: The value of Tmax was adjusted for this non-parametric analysis.
analysis.estimate_desc: The median difference was calculated as Cherry minus Peppermint.

outcome.title: Apparent Elimination Half-life of Nicotine T(1/2)
outcome.description: T(1/2) was calculated using plasma time-concentration values.
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples taken pre-dose and post-dose at 3, 5, 10, 15, 20, 30, 40, and 50 minutes, and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10 and 12 hours
outcome.population: Analysis was done per intention to treat (ITT) population.

measure.title: Apparent Elimination Half-life of Nicotine T(1/2)
measure.description: T(1/2) was calculated using plasma time-concentration values.
measure.population: Analysis was done per intention to treat (ITT) population.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis considered that there is no median within-subject difference between two treatment groups.
analysis.method_desc: The value of T (1/2) was adjusted for this non-parametric analysis.
analysis.estimate_desc: The median difference was calculated as Cherry minus Peppermint.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis considered that there is no median within-subject difference between two treatment groups.
analysis.method_desc: The value of T (1/2) was adjusted for this non-parametric analysis.
analysis.estimate_desc: The median difference was calculated as Cherry minus Peppermint.

outcome.description: Kel was calculated with the help of plasma time concentration values.

outcome.population: Analysis was done per intention to treat (ITT) population.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis considered that there is no median within-subject difference between two treatment groups.
analysis.method_desc: This non-parametric analysis was performed on the unadjusted values of parameters.
analysis.estimate_desc: The median difference was calculated as Cherry minus Peppermint.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis considered that there is no median within-subject difference between two treatment groups.
analysis.method_desc: This non-parametric analysis was performed on the unadjusted values of parameters.
analysis.estimate_desc: The median difference was calculated as Cherry minus Peppermint.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse Events were collected from the starting time of the investigational product, and until 5 days following last administration of the investigational product.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
